channel.title: Structs :: CC 410 Textbook
channel.description: Many object-oriented languages, such as C++ and C#, include the concept of a struct that form the basis of objects. A struct is an example of a compound data type, a data type composed from other types. This allows us to represent data in more complex ways by combining multiple primitive data types into a new type. This too, is a form of encapsulation, as it allows us to collect several values into a single data structure.
